trans-unit.source: Moves the file pointer of the specified file

seg-source.mrk: Moves the file pointer of the specified file

target.mrk: Moves the file pointer of the specified file

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Handle to the file to be processed

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the file to be processed

target.mrk: Handle to the file to be processed

trans-unit.source: Number of bytes to move the file pointer. Maximum value is 2^32

seg-source.mrk: Number of bytes to move the file pointer.
Maximum value is 2^32

target.mrk: Number of bytes to move the file pointer.
Maximum value is 2^32

trans-unit.source: A positive value moves the file pointer forward in the file, and a negative value moves the file pointer back.

seg-source.mrk: A positive value moves the file pointer forward in the file, and a negative value moves the file pointer back.

target.mrk: A positive value moves the file pointer forward in the file, and a negative value moves the file pointer back.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The starting point for the file pointer move.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
The starting point for the file pointer move.

target.mrk: [optional]
The starting point for the file pointer move.

trans-unit.source: Can be one of the predefined values:

seg-source.mrk: Can be one of the predefined values:

target.mrk: Can be one of the predefined values:

trans-unit.source: $FILE_BEGIN (0) = (default) The starting point is zero (0) or the beginning of the file

seg-source.mrk: $FILE_BEGIN (0) = (default) The starting point is zero (0) or the beginning of the file

target.mrk: $FILE_BEGIN (0) = (default) The starting point is zero (0) or the beginning of the file

trans-unit.source: $FILE_CURRENT (1) = The starting point is the current value of the file pointer.

seg-source.mrk: $FILE_CURRENT (1) = The starting point is the current value of the file pointer.

target.mrk: $FILE_CURRENT (1) = The starting point is the current value of the file pointer.

trans-unit.source: $FILE_END (2) = The starting point is the current end-of-file position.

seg-source.mrk: $FILE_END (2) = The starting point is the current end-of-file position.

target.mrk: $FILE_END (2) = The starting point is the current end-of-file position.

trans-unit.source: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: New file pointer.

seg-source.mrk: New file pointer.

target.mrk: New file pointer.

trans-unit.source: (-1) INVALID_SET_FILE_POINTER, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information

seg-source.mrk: (-1) INVALID_SET_FILE_POINTER, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information

target.mrk: (-1) INVALID_SET_FILE_POINTER, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: This function can also be used to query the current file pointer position by specifying a move method of FILE_CURRENT and a distance of zero.

seg-source.mrk: This function can also be used to query the current file pointer position by specifying a move method of FILE_CURRENT and a distance of zero.

target.mrk: This function can also be used to query the current file pointer position by specifying a move method of FILE_CURRENT and a distance of zero.

trans-unit.source: This function stores the file pointer in LONG value. To work with file pointers that are larger than a single LONG value, it must be used the SetFilePointerEx function.

seg-source.mrk: This function stores the file pointer in LONG value.
To work with file pointers that are larger than a single LONG value, it must be used the SetFilePointerEx function.

target.mrk: This function stores the file pointer in LONG value.
To work with file pointers that are larger than a single LONG value, it must be used the SetFilePointerEx function.

trans-unit.source: File pointer is the position in the file to read/write to/from by _WinAPI_ReadFile()/_WinAPI_WriteFile()

seg-source.mrk: File pointer is the position in the file to read/write to/from by _WinAPI_ReadFile()/_WinAPI_WriteFile()

target.mrk: File pointer is the position in the file to read/write to/from by _WinAPI_ReadFile()/_WinAPI_WriteFile()

trans-unit.source: 4) truncate file size to 12 bytes
